findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @aibymatt Employers increasingly value demonstrable skills and certifications over traditional degrees, especially in tech and data roles.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ArjunPatelAI Productivity jumps came when coordination costs dropped. This is similar to version control or cloud infrastructure in its early days.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @amelikendrick Wealth becomes a byproduct of solving real problems well.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @TobyReinhar Applying these long-horizon techniques to a standard RAG pipeline could drastically improve the success rate of multi-step autonomous tasks.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text:
@EvanWhitak This isn‚Äôt really a math tutorial, it‚Äôs a thinking tutorial. The math just happens to be the language used. 

That‚Äôs why it works for both beginners and experienced engineers.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text:

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @aibymatt The Blackberry question almost misses the point. Winners don‚Äôt ask who they‚Äôre replacing, they ask what future they‚Äôre pulling forward.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ArjunPatelAI The real progress comes from learning how to act while fear is still present.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @EvanWhitak The mix of structure and flexibility here is really well balanced. It feels realistic and sustainable.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @DBVolkov @EXM7777 tools don‚Äôt get smarter. workflows do.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @amelikendrick Steve Jobs dropped out of college but later credited a random calligraphy class for shaping Apple‚Äôs typography, proof that following curiosity can compound in surprising ways.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @TobyReinhar Love seeing discussions that pull back the curtain on launching new models.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ATrentham @guideforman A huge number of profitable saas products began as simple spreadsheets before becoming software.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @yulintwt Many breakthrough ai moments didn‚Äôt come from bigger models alone, but from better interfaces that let humans actually use that intelligence effectively.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @aibymatt Feels like visual creation is becoming as iterative and data driven as copywriting and product design, which is going to make marketing a lot more accessible to small teams

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ArjunPatelAI Historically, his philosophy pulled from multiple traditions and rejected purity.

findings.author: ethanjrowland
findings.text: @ATrentham We usually celebrate AI for making learning 'active,' but the take that learning should remain somewhat 'passive' is brilliant.

findings.author: Shpigford
findings.text:
i've got a rails app that uses hotwire (instead of my now-goto of inertia) and man is it painful.

rails + inertia.js is just miles ahead for any kind of interactive UX. not even remotely comparable.
